channel.title: What is the most scary movie ever?
channel.description:
so what movie do you think is the scareist movie ever!? tell me the name and the url in a reply im not cecking them though cause i dont want to pee in my pants lol :) anyways the url is the periview/trailer of the movie for other people to ceck it. So have fun and start posting scary movies!!!!!
i heard of hunnted kentecet i think you spell it like that i dont have the trailer sorry.... -.- :)...

item.title: What is the most scary movie ever?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

For me, the original exorcist is the #1 scariest.
A few years ago when they “remastered” it, i said what the hell and went to see it. Unfortunately, the
film had something wrong with it and they couldn’t get it to work for like 20 minutes. I found this as a
message from god and along with about 50 other people, walked right out of that theater.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the most scary movie ever?

item.title: What is the most scary movie ever?
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

The 70’s Exorcist is still considered the scariest movie of all time by critics and the media. If you look on the DVD or VHS, it even states that it’s considered the scariest movie of all time.

You may not believe it because we’re closing in on 2010. The movie was made in the 70’s to where digital effects were extremely limited. If you do your research on the movie you will find that numerous premature births happened within the theater of that movie. As well as fainting and extreme nausea.

The aspects of that movie are “scary” because it deals with something is considered real among many Christians today. It deals with possession, the devil and other various things that would be considered scary.

All in all though, I have yet to see the movie.

Paranormal Activity is okay

Read full topic

item.title: What is the most scary movie ever?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:42, topic:311154”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=407599.msg3019575#msg3019575 date=1257496371]

I would say Hills run red but then that movie is just grusome
My second choice would be saw but then those movies are hard to keep up with. (you need to watch 1,2,3,4 then 5)
Im left with Drag me to hell and the two kids The Ring and Grudge.

The thought of a little girl in a white dress just scares me.

Cloverfield was a bit like the mist. You dont really see the monsters

Bloody Mary makes me not close the bathroom door.

bloody mary is bs.

Is bloody mary supposed to be the bad version of Mary Popins?

I dont mind grusome movies but yesterday me and Jasmine watched Hills run red and she freaked out
[/quote]Its a scary movie of a girl who goes into ppls bathroom (shes hiding in the mirror) Then she kills then why they take a bubble bath D:>

Wow. Great thing i take showers then[/quote]Thats why the movie scares me!

Read full topic

item.description:

Hannah Montana - The movies, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=--H2ceqfRvI
[/quote]I lol’d.

Anyways, would be better if this was a thread for comedy movies, scary movies are getting kinda boring for me, it’s like there aren’t ANY scary movies all just crap…
[/quote] Your scared from Hannah Montana? Wait till you see Camp Rock.

You call THAT scary? All you have to do is watch High School Musical and you’ll be shitting your pants :P.[/quote]Seriously, i don’t get the point of those movies… It’s just singing and dancing all the time. Are we watching a movie or some music video, if i wanted to watch people singing and dancing i can just turn on my TV and watch MTV…
